no no it's not legally binding but they will want to have appointed someone by the end of the day em but will do is if I mean if they really like me then I can say I won't be able to accept until the end of next week

but you normally have to teach a lesson so it's like a whole day interview so you go for a day and you'll have a tour of the school probably meet members of staff and stuff you'll teach a lesson that lots of people will watch and then you'll have an interview with several people
mm

and they'll do that with maybe four or five candidates then they'll decide who they want and then they'll ring all the candidates up that evening and tell them whether or not they've given the job that's generally what happens
things move quickly in the teaching world
yeah which is why if you apply for a job where they decide not to bother doing it in that way mixed makes it all a bit
